intro: Alsinanthus dianthoides, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces elongated, branching stems that bear clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Alsinanthus dianthoides is adapted to withstand drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing desert ecosystems.
